svg.style: background: #FFFFFF; background-color: light-dark(#FFFFFF, #121212); color-scheme: light dark;
svg.content: <mxfile host="app.diagrams.net" agent="Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.15; rv:145.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/145.0" version="29.2.4" scale="1" border="0"> <diagram id="C2IEXcSJ2OIBP2LomFs8" name="Page-1"> <mxGraphModel dx="1426" dy="797" grid="0" gridSize="10" guides="1" tooltips="1" connect="1" arrows="1" fold="1" page="1" pageScale="1" pageWidth="827" pageHeight="1169" background="#FFFFFF" math="0" shadow="0"> <root> <mxCell id="0" /> <mxCell id="1" parent="0" /> <mxCell id="DtELGm-ESQxEywZzrc6y-13" parent="1" style="text;html=1;strokeColor=none;fillColor=none;align=left;verticalAlign=middle;whiteSpace=wrap;rounded=0;labelBackgroundColor=none;fontSize=24;fontColor=#000000;" value="<font style="font-size: 21px;">Why call it Sockets?</font>" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="47" width="207" x="364" y="195" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="DtELGm-ESQxEywZzrc6y-29" parent="1" style="text;html=1;strokeColor=#000000;fillColor=none;align=left;verticalAlign=middle;whiteSpace=wrap;rounded=0;labelBackgroundColor=none;fontSize=12;fontColor=#000000;strokeWidth=2;spacingLeft=4;spacing=6;" value="<div><b><br></b></div><div><b><br></b></div><div><b>Note that Sockets can mean many things such as:</b></div><div><b><br></b></div><ul><li><b>network socket (TCP-based stream sockets, UDP-based Datagram sockets, raw sockets)</b></li><li><b>hardware sockets</b></li><li><b>IPC sockets&nbsp;</b></li><li><b>WebSocket</b></li></ul><div><b><br></b></div><div><b>We use Socket to refer to a socket in Socket.io.</b></div><div><b><br></b></div><div><b>That's because Socket.io uses multiple protocols depending on the situation, thus the abbreviation Socket is a reference here to any type of socket in Socket.io.&nbsp;</b></div><div><b><br></b></div><div><b>Sockets in Socket.io are:</b></div><div><b><br></b></div><ul style="line-height: 160%;"><li><b>HTTP long-polling: as a fallback mechanism if WebSocket is not supported. https://socket.io/docs/v4/engine-io-protocol/#transports</b></li><li><b>WebSocket</b></li><li><b>WebTransport with HTTP/3: The project is moving towards using this when the protocol will be fully supported: https://socket.io/get-started/webtransport</b></li></ul><div><b><br><br></b></div>" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="498" width="348" x="367" y="255" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="HllYfcoa5QugPBEBhsl_-1" parent="1" style="text;html=1;strokeColor=none;fillColor=none;align=left;verticalAlign=middle;whiteSpace=wrap;rounded=0;fontSize=15;fontColor=#00CC00;" value="<font color="#1a1a1a" style="font-size: 40px;"><b style="">Sockets.io</b></font>" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="84" width="220" x="14" y="15" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="JpIGL8RyiZqf_9yPubLG-1" parent="1" style="text;html=1;strokeColor=none;fillColor=none;align=left;verticalAlign=middle;whiteSpace=wrap;rounded=0;labelBackgroundColor=none;fontSize=24;fontColor=#000000;" value="Why Sockets?" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="47" width="207" x="32" y="99" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="JpIGL8RyiZqf_9yPubLG-2" parent="1" style="text;html=1;strokeColor=none;fillColor=none;align=left;verticalAlign=middle;whiteSpace=wrap;rounded=0;labelBackgroundColor=none;fontSize=24;fontColor=#000000;" value="Scenario 1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="47" width="127" x="32" y="866" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="JpIGL8RyiZqf_9yPubLG-3" parent="1" style="text;html=1;strokeColor=none;fillColor=none;align=left;verticalAlign=middle;whiteSpace=wrap;rounded=0;labelBackgroundColor=none;fontSize=24;fontColor=#000000;" value="Scenario 2" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="47" width="130" x="32" y="1278" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="JpIGL8RyiZqf_9yPubLG-4" parent="1" style="text;html=1;strokeColor=#000000;fillColor=none;align=left;verticalAlign=middle;whiteSpace=wrap;rounded=0;labelBackgroundColor=none;fontSize=12;fontColor=#000000;strokeWidth=2;spacingLeft=4;spacing=6;" value="<div><b>Sockets can be used to send data between a client and a server.&nbsp;</b></div><div><b><br></b></div><div><b>Here are some scenarios that a fetch cannot accomplish*.</b></div><div><b><br></b></div><div><b><font style="font-size: 8px;">(Without techniques like short polling, long polling, SSE)</font></b></div>" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="117" width="244" x="32" y="158" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="JpIGL8RyiZqf_9yPubLG-5" parent="1" style="text;html=1;strokeColor=none;fillColor=none;align=left;verticalAlign=middle;whiteSpace=wrap;rounded=0;labelBackgroundColor=none;fontSize=24;fontColor=#000000;" value="<font style="font-size: 21px;">What are WebSockets?</font>" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="47" width="233.5" x="364" y="31" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="JpIGL8RyiZqf_9yPubLG-6" parent="1" style="text;html=1;strokeColor=#000000;fillColor=none;align=left;verticalAlign=middle;whiteSpace=wrap;rounded=0;labelBackgroundColor=none;fontSize=12;fontColor=#000000;strokeWidth=2;spacingLeft=4;spacing=6;" value="WebSocket is a browser supported communication protocol that enables bidirectional communication between a server and a client." vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="90" width="345" x="364" y="87" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <UserObject label="WebSocket" link="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WebSocket" id="JpIGL8RyiZqf_9yPubLG-8"> <mxCell parent="1" style="text;html=1;whiteSpace=wrap;strokeColor=none;fillColor=none;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;rounded=0;" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="30" width="60" x="374.5" y="102" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> </UserObject> <mxCell id="JpIGL8RyiZqf_9yPubLG-10" parent="1" style="text;html=1;strokeColor=#000000;fillColor=none;align=left;verticalAlign=middle;whiteSpace=wrap;rounded=0;labelBackgroundColor=none;fontSize=12;fontColor=#000000;strokeWidth=2;spacingLeft=4;spacing=6;" value="<div>A Server wants to update a client unprompted.</div>" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="68" width="244" x="34" y="921" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="JpIGL8RyiZqf_9yPubLG-11" parent="1" style="text;html=1;strokeColor=#000000;fillColor=none;align=left;verticalAlign=middle;whiteSpace=wrap;rounded=0;labelBackgroundColor=none;fontSize=12;fontColor=#000000;strokeWidth=2;spacingLeft=4;spacing=6;" value="<div>A client wants to communicate with other clients.&nbsp;</div><div><br></div><div>Solution: Emit to the server,&nbsp; the server emits to the clients.</div>" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="92" width="244" x="32" y="1364" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="JpIGL8RyiZqf_9yPubLG-12" parent="1" style="text;html=1;strokeColor=none;fillColor=none;align=left;verticalAlign=middle;whiteSpace=wrap;rounded=0;labelBackgroundColor=none;fontSize=24;fontColor=#000000;" value="Sockets.io implementation" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="47" width="127" x="30" y="296" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="JpIGL8RyiZqf_9yPubLG-13" parent="1" style="text;html=1;strokeColor=#000000;fillColor=none;align=left;verticalAlign=middle;whiteSpace=wrap;rounded=0;labelBackgroundColor=none;fontSize=12;fontColor=#000000;strokeWidth=2;spacingLeft=4;spacing=6;" value="<div>Socket.io works via events. Event strings are defined which are fired off and can be listened to.</div><div><br></div><div>Emit: transmits data.</div><div><br></div><div>On: listens and runs a callback function.</div>" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="117" width="244" x="30" y="374.5" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="JpIGL8RyiZqf_9yPubLG-15" parent="1" style="text;html=1;strokeColor=#000000;fillColor=none;align=left;verticalAlign=middle;whiteSpace=wrap;rounded=0;labelBackgroundColor=none;fontSize=12;fontColor=#000000;strokeWidth=2;spacingLeft=4;spacing=6;" value="<br><div><br></div><div>1. Send to the socket itself:</div><div><span style="color: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(0, 204, 0));">socket.emit()</span><br><br>2. Broadcast to all the sockets but itself:</div><div><span style="color: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(0, 204, 0));">socket.broadcast.emit()</span><br><br>3. Send to all the sockets in the namespace:</div><div><span style="color: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(0, 204, 0));">io.emit() // global namespace</span></div><div><span style="color: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(0, 204, 0));">io.of("somenamespace").emit()</span></div><div><br>https://socket.io/docs/v4/namespaces/</div><div><br>4. Send to a room:</div><div><span style="color: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(0, 204, 0));">io.to("some room").emit()<br></span><br></div><div>https://socket.io/docs/v4/rooms/</div><div><br><br><br></div>" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="260" width="244" x="30" y="568" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="JpIGL8RyiZqf_9yPubLG-16" parent="1" style="text;html=1;strokeColor=none;fillColor=none;align=left;verticalAlign=middle;whiteSpace=wrap;rounded=0;labelBackgroundColor=none;fontSize=24;fontColor=#000000;" value="<font style="font-size: 20px;">4 types of emit</font>" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="47" width="175" x="30" y="511" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="JpIGL8RyiZqf_9yPubLG-17" parent="1" style="verticalLabelPosition=bottom;html=1;verticalAlign=top;align=center;strokeColor=none;fillColor=#00BEF2;shape=mxgraph.azure.laptop;pointerEvents=1;" value="" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="105.5" width="155" x="56" y="1029.5" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="JpIGL8RyiZqf_9yPubLG-18" parent="1" style="image;aspect=fixed;perimeter=ellipsePerimeter;html=1;align=center;shadow=0;dashed=0;spacingTop=3;image=img/lib/active_directory/generic_server.svg;" value="" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="135.71" width="76" x="664" y="1014.39" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="JpIGL8RyiZqf_9yPubLG-19" edge="1" parent="1" style="shape=flexArrow;endArrow=classic;html=1;rounded=0;" value=""> <mxGeometry height="50" relative="1" width="50" as="geometry"> <mxPoint x="620" y="1085" as="sourcePoint" /> <mxPoint x="247" y="1055" as="targetPoint" /> </mxGeometry> </mxCell> <mxCell id="JpIGL8RyiZqf_9yPubLG-20" parent="1" style="text;html=1;whiteSpace=wrap;strokeColor=none;fillColor=none;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;rounded=0;" value="emit("some event", { data: true})" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="30" width="180" x="462" y="1024" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="JpIGL8RyiZqf_9yPubLG-21" parent="1" style="text;html=1;whiteSpace=wrap;strokeColor=none;fillColor=none;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;rounded=0;" value="on("some event", (data) =&gt; {})" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="30" width="177" x="215" y="1088" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="JpIGL8RyiZqf_9yPubLG-22" parent="1" style="verticalLabelPosition=bottom;html=1;verticalAlign=top;align=center;strokeColor=none;fillColor=#00BEF2;shape=mxgraph.azure.laptop;pointerEvents=1;" value="" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="105.5" width="155" x="46.5" y="1499" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="JpIGL8RyiZqf_9yPubLG-23" parent="1" style="verticalLabelPosition=bottom;html=1;verticalAlign=top;align=center;strokeColor=none;fillColor=#00BEF2;shape=mxgraph.azure.laptop;pointerEvents=1;" value="" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="105.5" width="155" x="46.5" y="1693" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="JpIGL8RyiZqf_9yPubLG-24" parent="1" height="135.71" width="76" x="652" y="1567" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="JpIGL8RyiZqf_9yPubLG-25" edge="1" parent="1" style="shape=flexArrow;endArrow=classic;html=1;rounded=0;" value=""> <mxGeometry height="50" relative="1" width="50" as="geometry"> <mxPoint x="233" y="1550" as="sourcePoint" /> <mxPoint x="609" y="1608" as="targetPoint" /> </mxGeometry> </mxCell> <mxCell id="JpIGL8RyiZqf_9yPubLG-26" parent="1" style="text;html=1;whiteSpace=wrap;strokeColor=none;fillColor=none;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;rounded=0;" value="emit("some event", { data: true})" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="30" width="180" x="201.5" y="1493" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="JpIGL8RyiZqf_9yPubLG-27" edge="1" parent="1" style="text;html=1;whiteSpace=wrap;strokeColor=none;fillColor=none;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;rounded=0;" value="on("some event", (data) =&gt; {})" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry height="30" width="177" x="193" y="1685" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> </root> </mxGraphModel> </diagram> </mxfile>

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 205px; height: 1px; padding-top: 204px; margin-left: 352px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left; color: #000000;
display: inline-block; font-size: 24px; font-family: Helvetica; color: light-dark(#000000, #ededed); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 334px; height: 1px; padding-top: 489px; margin-left: 363px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left; color: #000000;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: light-dark(#000000, #ededed); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.b: Note that Sockets can mean many things such as:

li.b: network socket (TCP-based stream sockets, UDP-based Datagram sockets, raw sockets)

div.b: We use Socket to refer to a socket in Socket.io.
That's because Socket.io uses multiple protocols depending on the situation, thus the abbreviation Socket is a reference here to any type of socket in Socket.io.

li.b: HTTP long-polling: as a fallback mechanism if WebSocket is not supported. https://socket.io/docs/v4/engine-io-protocol/#transports
WebTransport with HTTP/3: The project is moving towards using this when the protocol will be fully supported: https://socket.io/get-started/webtransport

switch.text: Note that Sockets can mean many things such as:...

div.b: Sockets can be used to send data between a client and a server.
Here are some scenarios that a fetch cannot accomplish*.

b.font: (Without techniques like short polling, long polling, SSE)

Solution: Emit to the server, the server emits to the clients.

socket.emit()
2. Broadcast to all the sockets but itself:

socket.broadcast.emit()
3. Send to all the sockets in the namespace:
